pageContext.claim: “Only 5 of 29 countries were making their commitment.  And that’s now changed.”
pageContext.analysis: Five of the 29 member states do currently spend 2 percent of GDP on defense, but three more are expected to meet this guideline by the end of 2018. However, that's somewhat beside the point. The deadline to reach the two percent spending guideline is still six years away and several members argue that total spending isn't the only way to measure commitment to the alliance.
